pullrequest.title: Feature: Implement XML parameter repackaging for detecting empty parameters

content.raw:
Removing the value that was hoisted up to be the "name" key makes the parameter invisible to `cvquery`, and also leads to code that doesn’t work when a second empty parameter appears.

I think the test failures might either be Windows-specific, or sporadic, since it didn’t happen every time. In any case, a library shouldn’t be patching a global system service without a very good reason, and I didn’t see one there. I thought I had gotten rid of the patching applied elsewhere.
content.html:
Removing the value that was hoisted up to be the "name" key makes the parameter invisible to cvquery, and also leads to code that doesn’t work when a second empty parameter appears.

I think the test failures might either be Windows-specific, or sporadic, since it didn’t happen every time. In any case, a library shouldn’t be patching a global system service without a very good reason, and I didn’t see one there. I thought I had gotten rid of the patching applied elsewhere.
